oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Homer Geiger to his mother regarding life on the front in France
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A seven page letter from Homer Geiger in which he talks about dealing with the mud in the fields. He writes that there have been no casualties, but they lost a horse. He describes an airfight and mentions that he has not heard from his girl "who must have other fish to fry." He writes that he will number his letters beginning with this as "number one" at the top of the first page. Homer Geiger served in Btry. B, 114th Field Art., 30th Div.
